text: Acleris caucasica is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in the Alps of Europe, the eastern Baltic region, the northern parts of European Russia, Georgia, Primorsk and Amur Territory, northern China and Iran. The wingspan is 12.5–15 mm., 2009: A brief study on the tribes Tortricini and Archipini (Lepidoptera: Tortricinae) from Iran. Entomofauna Band 30, Heft 10: 137–152. ==Taxonomy== The species is alternatively placed as a subspecies of Acleris lacordairana. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1962 caucasica Category:Moths of Europe Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris caucasica
